Browse the source code of netbsd/external/bsd/tre/dist/src/agrep.c

2 agrep.c - Approximate grep

5 See the file LICENSE for details and copyright.

34#endif

36#define _(String) gettext(String)

38#undef MAX
39#undef MIN
40#define MAX(a, b) (((a) >= (b)) ? (a) : (b))
41#define MIN(a, b) (((a) <= (b)) ? (a) : (b))
42
43/* Short options. */
44static char const short_options[] =
45"cd:e:hiklnqrsvwyBD:E:HI:MS:V0123456789-:";
46
47static int show_help;
48char *program_name;
49
50#ifdef HAVE_GETOPT_LONG
51/* Long options that have no corresponding short equivalents. */
52enum {
53 COLOR_OPTION = CHAR_MAX + 1,
54 SHOW_POSITION_OPTION
55};
56
57/* Long option equivalences. */
58static struct option const long_options[] =
59{
60 {"best-match", no_argument, NULL, 'B'},
61 {"color", no_argument, NULL, COLOR_OPTION},
62 {"colour", no_argument, NULL, COLOR_OPTION},
63 {"count", no_argument, NULL, 'c'},
64 {"delete-cost", required_argument, NULL, 'D'},
65 {"delimiter", no_argument, NULL, 'd'},
66 {"delimiter-after", no_argument, NULL, 'M'},
67 {"files-with-matches", no_argument, NULL, 'l'},
68 {"help", no_argument, &show_help, 1},
69 {"ignore-case", no_argument, NULL, 'i'},
70 {"insert-cost", required_argument, NULL, 'I'},
71 {"invert-match", no_argument, NULL, 'v'},
72 {"line-number", no_argument, NULL, 'n'},
73 {"literal", no_argument, NULL, 'k'},
74 {"max-errors", required_argument, NULL, 'E'},
75 {"no-filename", no_argument, NULL, 'h'},
76 {"nothing", no_argument, NULL, 'y'},
77 {"quiet", no_argument, NULL, 'q'},
78 {"record-number", no_argument, NULL, 'n'},
79 {"recursive", no_argument, NULL, 'r'},
80 {"regexp", required_argument, NULL, 'e'},
81 {"show-cost", no_argument, NULL, 's'},
82 {"show-position", no_argument, NULL, SHOW_POSITION_OPTION},
83 {"silent", no_argument, NULL, 'q'},
84 {"substitute-cost", required_argument, NULL, 'S'},
85 {"version", no_argument, NULL, 'V'},
86 {"with-filename", no_argument, NULL, 'H'},
87 {"word-regexp", no_argument, NULL, 'w'},
88 {0, 0, 0, 0}
89};
90#endif /* HAVE_GETOPT_LONG */
91
92__dead static void
93tre_agrep_usage(int status)
94{
95 if (status != 0)
96 {
97 fprintf(stderr, _("Usage: %s [OPTION]... PATTERN [FILE]...\n"),
98 program_name);
99 fprintf(stderr, _("Try `%s --help' for more information.\n"),
100 program_name);
101 }
102 else
103 {
104 printf(_("Usage: %s [OPTION]... PATTERN [FILE]...\n"), program_name);
105 printf(_("\
106Searches for approximate matches of PATTERN in each FILE or standard input.\n\
107Example: `%s -2 optimize foo.txt' outputs all lines in file `foo.txt' that\n\
108match \"optimize\" within two errors. E.g. lines which contain \"optimise\",\n\
109\"optmise\", and \"opitmize\" all match.\n"), program_name);
110 printf("\n");
111 printf(_("\
112Regexp selection and interpretation:\n\
113 -e, --regexp=PATTERN use PATTERN as a regular expression\n\
114 -i, --ignore-case ignore case distinctions\n\
115 -k, --literal PATTERN is a literal string\n\
116 -w, --word-regexp force PATTERN to match only whole words\n\
117\n\
118Approximate matching settings:\n\
119 -D, --delete-cost=NUM set cost of missing characters\n\
120 -I, --insert-cost=NUM set cost of extra characters\n\
121 -S, --substitute-cost=NUM set cost of wrong characters\n\
122 -E, --max-errors=NUM select records that have at most NUM errors\n\
123 -# select records that have at most # errors (# is a\n\
124 digit between 0 and 9)\n\
125\n\
126Miscellaneous:\n\
127 -d, --delimiter=PATTERN set the record delimiter regular expression\n\
128 -v, --invert-match select non-matching records\n\
129 -V, --version print version information and exit\n\
130 -r, --recursive also search in any subdirectories\n\
131 -y, --nothing does nothing (for compatibility with the non-free\n\
132 agrep program)\n\
133 --help display this help and exit\n\
134\n\
135Output control:\n\
136 -B, --best-match only output records with least errors\n\
137 -c, --count only print a count of matching records per FILE\n\
138 -h, --no-filename suppress the prefixing filename on output\n\
139 -H, --with-filename print the filename for each match\n\
140 -l, --files-with-matches only print FILE names containing matches\n\
141 -M, --delimiter-after print record delimiter after record if -d is used\n\
142 -n, --record-number print record number with output\n\
143 --line-number same as -n\n\
144 -q, --quiet, --silent suppress all normal output\n\
145 -s, --show-cost print match cost with output\n\
146 --colour, --color use markers to distinguish the matching \
147strings\n\
148 --show-position prefix each output record with start and end\n\
149 position of the first match within the record\n"));
150 printf("\n");
151 printf(_("\
152With no FILE, or when FILE is -, reads standard input. If less than two\n\
153FILEs are given, -h is assumed. Exit status is 0 if a match is found, 1 for\n\
154no match, and 2 if there were errors. If -E or -# is not specified, only\n\
155exact matches are selected.\n"));
156 printf("\n");
157 printf(_("\
158PATTERN is a POSIX extended regular expression (ERE) with the TRE extensions.\n\
159See tre(7) for a complete description.\n"));
160 printf("\n");
161 printf(_("Report bugs to: "));
162 printf("%s.\n", PACKAGE_BUGREPORT);
163 }
164 exit(status);
165}
166
167static regex_t preg; /* Compiled pattern to search for. */
168static regex_t delim; /* Compiled record delimiter pattern. */
169
170#define INITIAL_BUF_SIZE 10240 /* Initial size of the buffer. */
171static char *buf; /* Buffer for scanning text. */
172static int buf_size; /* Current size of the buffer. */
173static int data_len; /* Amount of data in the buffer. */
174static char *record; /* Start of current record. */
175static char *next_record; /* Start of next record. */
176static int record_len; /* Length of current record. */
177static int delim_len; /* Length of delimiter before record. */
178static int next_delim_len; /* Length of delimiter after record. */
179static int delim_after = 1;/* If true, print the delimiter after the record. */
180static int at_eof;
181static int have_matches; /* If true, matches have been found. */
182
183static int invert_match; /* Show only non-matching records. */
184static int print_filename; /* Output filename. */
185static int print_recnum; /* Output record number. */
186static int print_cost; /* Output match cost. */
187static int count_matches; /* Count matching records. */
188static int list_files; /* List matching files. */
189static int color_option; /* Highlight matches. */
190static int print_position; /* Show start and end offsets for matches. */
191static int recursive; /* Search in subdirectories too */
192
193static int best_match; /* Output only best matches. */
194static int best_cost; /* Best match cost found so far. */
195static int be_silent; /* Never output anything */
196
197static regaparams_t match_params;
198
199/* The color string used with the --color option. If set, the
200 environment variable GREP_COLOR overrides this default value. */
201static const char *highlight = "01;31";
202
203/* Sets `record' to the next complete record from file `fd', and `record_len'
204 to the length of the record. Returns 1 when there are no more records,
205 0 otherwise. */
206static inline int
207tre_agrep_get_next_record(int fd, const char *filename)
208{
209 if (at_eof)
210 return 1;
211
212 while (1)
213 {
214 int errcode;
215 regmatch_t pmatch[1];
216
217 if (next_record == NULL)
218 {
219 int r;
220 int read_size = buf_size - data_len;
221
222 if (read_size <= 0)
223 {
224 /* The buffer is full and no record delimiter found yet,
225 we need to grow the buffer. We double the size to
226 avoid rescanning the data too many times when the
227 records are very large. */
228 buf_size *= 2;
229 buf = realloc(buf, buf_size);
230 if (buf == NULL)
231 {
232 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", program_name, _("Out of memory"));
233 exit(2);
234 }
235 read_size = buf_size - data_len;
236 }
237
238 r = read(fd, buf + data_len, read_size);
239 if (r < 0)
240 {
241 /* Read error. */
242 char *err;
243 if (errno == EINTR)
244 continue;
245 err = strerror(errno);
246 fprintf(stderr, "%s: ", program_name);
247 fprintf(stderr, _("Error reading from %s: %s\n"), filename, err);
248 return 1;
249 }
250
251 if (r == 0)
252 {
253 /* End of file. Return the last record. */
254 record = buf;
255 record_len = data_len;
256 at_eof = 1;
257 /* The empty string after a trailing delimiter is not considered
258 to be a record. */
259 if (record_len == 0)
260 return 1;
261 return 0;
262 }
263 data_len += r;
264 next_record = buf;
265 }
266
267 /* Find the next record delimiter. */
268 errcode = tre_regnexec(&delim, next_record, data_len - (next_record - buf),
269 1, pmatch, 0);
270
271
272 switch (errcode)
273 {
274 case REG_OK:
275 /* Record delimiter found, now we know how long the current
276 record is. */
277 record = next_record;
278 record_len = pmatch[0].rm_so;
279 delim_len = next_delim_len;
280
281 next_delim_len = pmatch[0].rm_eo - pmatch[0].rm_so;
282 next_record = next_record + pmatch[0].rm_eo;
283 return 0;
284 break;
285
286 case REG_NOMATCH:
287 if (next_record == buf)
288 {
289 next_record = NULL;
290 continue;
291 }
292
293 /* Move the data to start of the buffer and read more
294 data. */
295 memmove(buf, next_record, buf + data_len - next_record);
296 data_len = buf + data_len - next_record;
297 next_record = NULL;
298 continue;
299 break;
300
301 case REG_ESPACE:
302 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", program_name, _("Out of memory"));
303 exit(2);
304 break;
305
306 default:
307 assert(0);
308 break;
309 }
310 }
311}
312
313#include <sys/types.h>
314#include <sys/stat.h>
315#include <sys/mman.h>
316
317#include <dirent.h>
318
319static int
320isbinaryfile(const char *filename)
321{
322 struct stat st;
323 size_t size;
324 size_t i;
325 char *mapped;
326 FILE *fp;
327 int isbin;
328
329 if ((fp = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL) {
330 return 1;
331 }
332 fstat(fileno(fp), &st);
333 isbin = 0;
334 if ((st.st_mode & S_IFMT) != S_IFREG) {
335 isbin = 1;
336 } else {
337 size = (size_t)st.st_size;
338 mapped = mmap(NULL, size, PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED, fileno(fp), 0);
339 for (i = 0 ; !isbin && i < size ; i++) {
340 if (mapped[i] == 0x0) {
341 isbin = 1;
342 }
343 }
344 munmap(mapped, size);
345 }
346 fclose(fp);
347 return isbin;
348}
349
350static int tre_agrep_handle_file(const char */*filename*/);
351
352static int
353tre_agrep_handle_dirent(const char *ent)
354{
355 struct dirent storage;
356 struct dirent *dp;
357 struct stat st;
358 char path[8192];
359 DIR *dirp;
360 int ret;
361 int ok;
362
363 if (ent == NULL || strcmp(ent, "-") == 0) {
364 return tre_agrep_handle_file(ent);
365 }
366 if (lstat(ent, &st) < 0) {
367 return tre_agrep_handle_file(ent);
368 }
369 if ((st.st_mode & S_IFMT) == S_IFDIR && recursive) {
370 if ((dirp = opendir(ent)) == NULL) {
371 fprintf(stderr, "can't open directory '%s'\n", ent);
372 return 0;
373 }
374 for (ret = 0 ; readdir_r(dirp, &storage, &dp) == 0 && dp != NULL ; ) {
375 if (strcmp(dp->d_name, ".") == 0 ||
376 strcmp(dp->d_name, "..") == 0) {
377 continue;
378 }
379 snprintf(path, sizeof(path), "%s/%s", ent, dp->d_name);
380 if ((ok = tre_agrep_handle_dirent(path)) != 0) {
381 ret = ok;
382 }
383 }
384 closedir(dirp);
385 return ret;
386 }
387 return tre_agrep_handle_file(ent);
388}
389
390static int
391tre_agrep_handle_file(const char *filename)
392{
393 int fd;
394 int count = 0;
395 int recnum = 0;
396
397 /* Allocate the initial buffer. */
398 if (buf == NULL)
399 {
400 buf = malloc(INITIAL_BUF_SIZE);
401 if (buf == NULL)
402 {
403 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", program_name, _("Out of memory"));
404 exit(2);
405 }
406 buf_size = INITIAL_BUF_SIZE;
407 }
408
409 /* Reset read buffer state. */
410 next_record = NULL;
411 data_len = 0;
412
413 if (!filename || strcmp(filename, "-") == 0)
414 {
415 if (best_match)
416 {
417 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", program_name,
418 _("Cannot use -B when reading from standard input."));
419 return 2;
420 }
421 fd = 0;
422 filename = _("(standard input)");
423 }
424 else
425 {
426 fd = open(filename, O_RDONLY);
427 }
428
429 if (fd < 0)
430 {
431 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: %s\n", program_name, filename, strerror(errno));
432 return 1;
433 }
434
435
436 /* Go through all records and output the matching ones, or the non-matching
437 ones if `invert_match' is true. */
438 at_eof = 0;
439 while (!tre_agrep_get_next_record(fd, filename))
440 {
441 int errcode;
442 regamatch_t match;
443 regmatch_t pmatch[1];
444 recnum++;
445 memset(&match, 0, sizeof(match));
446 if (best_match)
447 match_params.max_cost = best_cost;
448 if (color_option || print_position)
449 {
450 match.pmatch = pmatch;
451 match.nmatch = 1;
452 }
453
454 /* Stop searching for better matches if an exact match is found. */
455 if (best_match == 1 && best_cost == 0)
456 break;
457
458 /* See if the record matches. */
459 errcode = tre_reganexec(&preg, record, record_len, &match, match_params, 0);
460 if ((!invert_match && errcode == REG_OK)
461 || (invert_match && errcode == REG_NOMATCH))
462 {
463 if (be_silent)
464 exit(0);
465
466 count++;
467 have_matches = 1;
468 if (best_match)
469 {
470 if (best_match == 1)
471 {
472 /* First best match pass. */
473 if (match.cost < best_cost)
474 best_cost = match.cost;
475 continue;
476 }
477 /* Second best match pass. */
478 if (match.cost > best_cost)
479 continue;
480 }
481
482 if (list_files)
483 {
484 printf("%s\n", filename);
485 break;
486 }
487 else if (!count_matches && isbinaryfile(filename))
488 {
489 if (print_filename)
490 printf("Binary file %s matches\n", filename);
491 }
492 else if (!count_matches)
493 {
494 if (print_filename)
495 printf("%s:", filename);
496 if (print_recnum)
497 printf("%d:", recnum);
498 if (print_cost)
499 printf("%d:", match.cost);
500 if (print_position)
501 printf("%d-%d:",
502 invert_match ? 0 : (int)pmatch[0].rm_so,
503 invert_match ? record_len : (int)pmatch[0].rm_eo);
504
505 /* Adjust record boundaries so we print the delimiter
506 before or after the record. */
507 if (delim_after)
508 {
509 record_len += next_delim_len;
510 }
511 else
512 {
513 record -= delim_len;
514 record_len += delim_len;
515 pmatch[0].rm_so += delim_len;
516 pmatch[0].rm_eo += delim_len;
517 }
518
519 if (color_option && !invert_match)
520 {
521 printf("%.*s", (int)pmatch[0].rm_so, record);
522 printf("\33[%sm", highlight);
523 printf("%.*s", (int)(pmatch[0].rm_eo - pmatch[0].rm_so),
524 record + pmatch[0].rm_so);
525 fputs("\33[00m", stdout);
526 printf("%.*s", (int)(record_len - pmatch[0].rm_eo),
527 record + pmatch[0].rm_eo);
528 }
529 else
530 {
531 printf("%.*s", record_len, record);
532 }
533 }
534 }
535 }
536
537 if (count_matches && !best_match && !be_silent)
538 {
539 if (print_filename)
540 printf("%s:", filename);
541 printf("%d\n", count);
542 }
543
544 if (fd)
545 close(fd);
546
547 return 0;
548}
549
550
551
552int
553main(int argc, char **argv)
554{
555 int c, errcode;
556 int comp_flags = REG_EXTENDED;
557 char *tmp_str;
558 char *regexp = NULL;
559 const char *delim_regexp = "\n";
560 int word_regexp = 0;
561 int literal_string = 0;
562 int max_cost_set = 0;
563
564 setlocale (LC_ALL, "");
565 bindtextdomain (PACKAGE, LOCALEDIR);
566 textdomain (PACKAGE);
567
568 /* Get the program name without the path (for error messages etc). */
569 program_name = argv[0];
570 if (program_name)
571 {
572 tmp_str = strrchr(program_name, '/');
573 if (tmp_str)
574 program_name = tmp_str + 1;
575 }
576
577 /* Defaults. */
578 print_filename = -1;
579 print_cost = 0;
580 be_silent = 0;
581 tre_regaparams_default(&match_params);
582 match_params.max_cost = 0;
583
584 /* Parse command line options. */
585 while (1)
586 {
587#ifdef HAVE_GETOPT_LONG
588 c = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_options, long_options, NULL);
589#else /* !HAVE_GETOPT_LONG */
590 c = getopt(argc, argv, short_options);
591#endif /* !HAVE_GETOPT_LONG */
592 if (c == -1)
593 break;
594
595 switch (c)
596 {
597 case 'c':
598 /* Count number of matching records. */
599 count_matches = 1;
600 break;
601 case 'd':
602 /* Set record delimiter regexp. */
603 delim_regexp = optarg;
604 if (delim_after == 1)
605 delim_after = 0;
606 break;
607 case 'e':
608 /* Regexp to use. */
609 regexp = optarg;
610 break;
611 case 'h':
612 /* Don't prefix filename on output if there are multiple files. */
613 print_filename = 0;
614 break;
615 case 'i':
616 /* Ignore case. */
617 comp_flags |= REG_ICASE;
618 break;
619 case 'k':
620 /* The pattern is a literal string. */
621 literal_string = 1;
622 break;
623 case 'l':
624 /* Only print files that contain matches. */
625 list_files = 1;
626 break;
627 case 'n':
628 /* Print record number of matching record. */
629 print_recnum = 1;
630 break;
631 case 'q':
632 be_silent = 1;
633 break;
634 case 'r':
635 /* also search in sub-directories */
636 recursive = 1;
637 print_filename = 1;
638 break;
639 case 's':
640 /* Print match cost of matching record. */
641 print_cost = 1;
642 break;
643 case 'v':
644 /* Select non-matching records. */
645 invert_match = 1;
646 break;
647 case 'w':
648 /* Match only whole words. */
649 word_regexp = 1;
650 break;
651 case 'y':
652 /* Compatibility option, does nothing. */
653 break;
654 case 'B':
655 /* Select only the records which have the best match. */
656 best_match = 1;
657 break;
658 case 'D':
659 /* Set the cost of a deletion. */
660 match_params.cost_del = atoi(optarg);
661 break;
662 case 'E':
663 /* Set the maximum number of errors allowed for a record to match. */
664 match_params.max_cost = atoi(optarg);
665 max_cost_set = 1;
666 break;
667 case 'H':
668 /* Always print filename prefix on output. */
669 print_filename = 1;
670 break;
671 case 'I':
672 /* Set the cost of an insertion. */
673 match_params.cost_ins = atoi(optarg);
674 break;
675 case 'M':
676 /* Print delimiters after matches instead of before. */
677 delim_after = 2;
678 break;
679 case 'S':
680 /* Set the cost of a substitution. */
681 match_params.cost_subst = atoi(optarg);
682 break;
683 case 'V':
684 {
685 /* Print version string and exit. */
686 char *version;
687 tre_config(TRE_CONFIG_VERSION, &version);
688 printf("%s (TRE agrep) %s\n\n", program_name, version);
689 printf(_("\
690Copyright (c) 2001-2009 Ville Laurikari <vl@iki.fi>.\n"));
691 printf("\n");
692 exit(0);
693 break;
694 }
695 case '?':
696 /* Ambiguous match or extraneous parameter. */
697 break;
698
699 case '-':
700 /* Emulate some long options on systems which don't
701 have getopt_long. */
702 if (strcmp(optarg, "color") == 0
703 || strcmp(optarg, "colour") == 0)
704 color_option = 1;
705 else if (strcmp(optarg, "show-position") == 0)
706 print_position = 1;
707 else if (strcmp(optarg, "help") == 0)
708 show_help = 1;
709 else
710 {
711 fprintf(stderr, _("%s: invalid option --%s\n"),
712 program_name, optarg);
713 exit(2);
714 }
715 break;
716
717#ifdef HAVE_GETOPT_LONG
718 case COLOR_OPTION:
719 color_option = 1;
720 break;
721 case SHOW_POSITION_OPTION:
722 print_position = 1;
723 break;
724#endif /* HAVE_GETOPT_LONG */
725 case 0:
726 /* Long options without corresponding short options. */
727 break;
728
729 default:
730 if (c >= '0' && c <= '9')
731 match_params.max_cost = c - '0';
732 else
733 tre_agrep_usage(2);
734 max_cost_set = 1;
735 break;
736 }
737 }
738
739 if (show_help)
740 tre_agrep_usage(0);
741
742 if (color_option)
743 {
744 char *user_highlight = getenv("GREP_COLOR");
745 if (user_highlight && *user_highlight != '\0')
746 highlight = user_highlight;
747 }
748
749 /* Get the pattern. */
750 if (regexp == NULL)
751 {
752 if (optind >= argc)
753 tre_agrep_usage(2);
754 regexp = argv[optind++];
755 }
756
757 /* If -k is specified, make the regexp literal. This uses
758 the \Q and \E extensions. If the string already contains
759 occurrences of \E, we need to handle them separately. This is a
760 pain, but can't really be avoided if we want to create a regexp
761 which works together with -w (see below). */
762 if (literal_string)
763 {
764 char *next_pos = regexp;
765 char *new_re, *new_re_end;
766 int n = 0;
767 int len;
768
769 next_pos = regexp;
770 while (next_pos)
771 {
772 next_pos = strstr(next_pos, "\\E");
773 if (next_pos)
774 {
775 n++;
776 next_pos += 2;
777 }
778 }
779
780 len = strlen(regexp);
781 new_re = malloc(len + 5 + n * 7);
782 if (!new_re)
783 {
784 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", program_name, _("Out of memory"));
785 return 2;
786 }
787
788 next_pos = regexp;
789 new_re_end = new_re;
790 strcpy(new_re_end, "\\Q");
791 new_re_end += 2;
792 while (next_pos)
793 {
794 char *start = next_pos;
795 next_pos = strstr(next_pos, "\\E");
796 if (next_pos)
797 {
798 strncpy(new_re_end, start, next_pos - start);
799 new_re_end += next_pos - start;
800 strcpy(new_re_end, "\\E\\\\E\\Q");
801 new_re_end += 7;
802 next_pos += 2;
803 }
804 else
805 {
806 strcpy(new_re_end, start);
807 new_re_end += strlen(start);
808 }
809 }
810 strcpy(new_re_end, "\\E");
811 regexp = new_re;
812 }
813
814 /* If -w is specified, prepend beginning-of-word and end-of-word
815 assertions to the regexp before compiling. */
816 if (word_regexp)
817 {
818 char *tmp = regexp;
819 int len = strlen(tmp);
820 regexp = malloc(len + 7);
821 if (regexp == NULL)
822 {
823 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", program_name, _("Out of memory"));
824 return 2;
825 }
826 strcpy(regexp, "\\<(");
827 strcpy(regexp + 3, tmp);
828 strcpy(regexp + len + 3, ")\\>");
829 }
830
831 /* Compile the pattern. */
832 errcode = tre_regcomp(&preg, regexp, comp_flags);
833 if (errcode)
834 {
835 char errbuf[256];
836 tre_regerror(errcode, &preg, errbuf, sizeof(errbuf));
837 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: %s\n",
838 program_name, _("Error in search pattern"), errbuf);
839 return 2;
840 }
841
842 /* Compile the record delimiter pattern. */
843 errcode = tre_regcomp(&delim, delim_regexp, REG_EXTENDED | REG_NEWLINE);
844 if (errcode)
845 {
846 char errbuf[256];
847 tre_regerror(errcode, &preg, errbuf, sizeof(errbuf));
848 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s: %s\n",
849 program_name, _("Error in record delimiter pattern"), errbuf);
850 return 2;
851 }
852
853 if (tre_regexec(&delim, "", 0, NULL, 0) == REG_OK)
854 {
855 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s\n", program_name,
856 _("Record delimiter pattern must not match an empty string"));
857 return 2;
858 }
859
860 /* The rest of the arguments are file(s) to match. */
861
862 /* If -h or -H were not specified, print filenames if there are more
863 than one files specified. */
864 if (print_filename == -1)
865 {
866 if (argc - optind <= 1)
867 print_filename = 0;
868 else
869 print_filename = 1;
870 }
871
872 if (optind >= argc)
873 {
874 /* There are no files specified, read from stdin. */
875 tre_agrep_handle_file(NULL);
876 }
877 else if (best_match)
878 {
879 int first_ind = optind;
880
881 /* Best match mode. Set up the limits first. */
882 if (!max_cost_set)
883 match_params.max_cost = INT_MAX;
884 best_cost = INT_MAX;
885
886 /* Scan all files once without outputting anything, searching
887 for the best matches. */
888 while (optind < argc)
889 tre_agrep_handle_dirent(argv[optind++]);
890
891 /* If there were no matches, bail out now. */
892 if (best_cost == INT_MAX)
893 return 1;
894
895 /* Otherwise, rescan the files with max_cost set to the cost
896 of the best match found previously, this time outputting
897 the matches. */
898 match_params.max_cost = best_cost;
899 best_match = 2;
900 optind = first_ind;
901 while (optind < argc)
902 tre_agrep_handle_dirent(argv[optind++]);
903 }
904 else
905 {
906 /* Normal mode. */
907 while (optind < argc)
908 tre_agrep_handle_dirent(argv[optind++]);
909 }
910
911 return have_matches == 0;
912}
913
